snippet: After talks on a compromise collapsed, worse bloodshed is possible.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Egypt's military for threatening to forcibly disperse tens of thousands of supporters of ousted Pres Mohamed Morsi from two sit-ins in Cairo, instead of attempting to reach a compromise with them; contends United States must keep making the case for a political solution and should be prepared to condemn the army and consider stronger action with Europe and the Arab world if more bloodshed occurs.
lead_paragraph: After talks on a compromise collapsed, worse bloodshed is possible.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
